intro: Leucadendron gandogeri, commonly known as the Knysna yellow bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, yellowish-green foliage and striking yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and is well adapted to the coastal climate of the Knysna region. Its flowers are composed of numerous small, petal-like bracts that give it a unique and ornamental appearance. Leucadendron gandogeri is also valued for its ecological role, providing habitat and food for local wildlife.
